p: Terminalia brownii Fresen. has been used to treat brown-erythematous excoriated papules, plaques, and lichenification in the formulation of scented smoke baths ( Kibar Ozturk et al., 2018). In traditional medicine in Southeast Asia, the aqueous extract of Terminalia catappa L. leaves are used to treat antipyretic, hemostatic, hepatitis, and liver-related diseases T. catappa L. is also used to manage diabetic due to its property of reducing oxidative stress, inflammation, angiogenesis, lipid profile correction, and direct hypoglycemic actions ( Behl and Kotwani, 2017). Extracts from the leaves of T. catappa L. has been reported to attenuate the growth of Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 25923) and Pseudomonas aeruginosa (ATCC 27853) ( Allyn et al., 2018). Besides, methanolic extracts from T. catappa L. are found to prevent hydrogen peroxide-induced oxidative damage in human fibroblasts (Hs68), thereby can be potentially used to manage skin aging ( Huang et al., 2018).
